justification: "Explicit valuation: In this task participants were shown either a picture of a juice carton … or a pound coin … Participants were asked to provide answers to three questions on a scale from 1 (least) to 6 (most)."
"We developed a novel task for measuring willingness to work … Participants were required to make binary yes/no choices whether they were willing to exert varying levels of cognitive effort …"
"We used a standard go-no-go task … Participants were required to press 'f' or 'k' … or omit an answer depending on the color …"

measured_by: NASA Task Load Index (cognitive load item)
justification: "After each answer they were required to provide answers on the NASA Task Load Index. We used the cognitive load question as an indicator of exerted cognitive effort."
"We compared both groups on the need for cognition scale because we wanted to ensure that one group would not be inherently more willing to exert cognitive effort …"

measured_by: Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence II – Matrix Reasoning subtest
justification: "Furthermore, we administered the matrix reasoning subtest of the Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence II."

measured_by: Self-report thirst questions (adapted from prior work)
justification: "We tested whether differences in subjective value could have arisen because adults or children were more thirsty … we adapted questions from previous work."
